active_alerts.description: To travel from the North Station platform to the Fitchburg platform, travel east on Maple St towards Main St. At Main St., turn left and continue to Railroad St. At Rairoad St., turn lefr and continue to the station, where a ramp to the Fitchburg platform is located next the small parking lot. To travel from the Fitchburg platform to the North Station platform, travel to the east end of the platform and proceed down the ramp to the small parking lot. Continue east on Railroad St. to Main St. At Main St., turn right and continue to Maple St. At Maple St., turn right and continue to the walkway that leads to the platform.

The escalator will remain out of service for the foreseeable future. This decision was made after a thorough inspection determined that corrosion on the escalator’s steel truss was so severe that it could not be repaired further and that a complete replacement of the escalator would be required. Replacing the escalator at this location requires a more extended unit meeting modern escalator safety requirements. This longer unit will require significant alteration to the station entrance to meet code requirements. The MBTA has currently begun design work to understand what station upgrades will be needed. 
  
Due to these complexities, we expect the escalator will remain out of service for a significant time. We recognize the challenges this poses to our riders, and please know we are working to identify a solution as quickly as possible. In the meantime, Government Center Station, which is fully accessible and serves the Blue Line, is under a quarter-mile from Bowdoin Station.

Affected lines:
Providence/Stoughton Line
Foxboro (Special Events)

-Extra staff will be onsite to assist. 
-Visit MBTA.com/CRGATES for more information.
-Fairmount Line riders paying with a CharlieCard must validate their fare before entering or exiting the fare gates. 
-If your trip begins at South Station, validate your CharlieCard at the fare vending machines near the station's ticket office. You'll then be able to tap your CharlieCard at the gate. 
-If your trip ends at South Station, you'll need to see a conductor onboard or staff on the station platform to get an exit ticket. You'll scan this ticket at a reader to exit the gate. 
-Fairmount Line Zone 1A stations will receive new Fare Vending Machines for CharlieCard validation for Commuter Rail use.

Affected routes:
89
101

There are accessible mini-high platforms at the Western end of both the Track 1 and Track 2 sides. However, the existing pedestrian path between the two sides is long and includes steep slopes, especially on the Crest Road bridge over the tracks. Designs are underway to provide for a fully compliant pathway.

- A diversion schedule will be in effect.

- An express shuttle will operate nonstop between North Station and Anderson/Woburn.

- A local shuttle will operate between North Station and Anderson/Woburn, making all local stops.

-Riders using the shuttle buses should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to North Station from Anderson/Woburn should budget up to 15 minutes additional travel on the express shuttle and up to 40 minutes additional travel on the local shuttle.

Shuttle bus pick up/drop off locations:

NORTH STATION: Nashua St @ Red Auerbach Way

WEST MEDFORD: Inbound – High St @ Canal St (MBTA Routes 94, 95, & 326 bus stop)
Outbound – High St @ Warren St (MBTA Routes 94, 95, & 326 bus stop)

WEDGEMERE: Wedgemere Station Parking Lot (inbound side)

WINCHESTER CENTER: Laraway Rd @ Winchester Center Station (MBTA Route 134 bus stop)

ANDERSON/WOBURN: Anderson/Woburn Station Busway (adjacent to Logan Express bus stop)

Affected lines:
Fall River/New Bedford Line
Newburyport/Rockport Line
Haverhill Line
Lowell Line
Fitchburg Line
Framingham/Worcester Line
Needham Line
Franklin/Foxboro Line
Fairmount Line
Providence/Stoughton Line
Kingston Line
Greenbush Line
Scheduled to complete sometime in 2027, the Reconstruction of Foster Street includes widening and resurfacing with the addition of bicycle lanes.

To exit, exit the train at Revere Beach, then take a Bowdoin-bound train to Beachmont and use Beachmont Elevator 886. To board, use Beachmont Elevator 886 to access the Bowdoin platform. Take a Bowdoin-bound train to Suffolk Downs, then transfer to a Wonderland-bound train.

Affected lines:
Fall River/New Bedford Line

Customer Support Link:
https://www.mbta.com/customer-support 

Customer Support Phone Number:
617-222-3200 (Monday - Friday: 6:30 AM - 8 PM)

Affected routes:
Framingham/Worcester Line
Franklin Line
Fairmount Line
Providence/Stoughton Line
Middleborough/Lakeville Line
Kingston/Plymouth Line
Greenbush Line
Please use nearby Lechmere Elevator 762.
Please use nearby Winchester Center Elevator 748.

Affected direction: Outbound

Affected stops:
Tremont St opp St Mary's High School
Market St @ Tremont St

To exit, use North Quincy Elevator 900 to access the main lobby at West Squantum St. Upon exiting the main lobby, turn right onto West Squantum St, then turn right on the ramp to Newport Ave Extension. Continue for approx. 900 feet to the Newport Ave parking lot entrance. To board, exit the Newport Ave parking lot, turn left and travel approx. 900 ft. along Newport Ave Extension and up the ramp to West Squantum St. At West Squantum St, turn left and continue to the North Quincy main entrance and use North Quincy Elevator 900. See station personnel or use a station call box to request assistance.

Affected direction: Outbound

Affected stops:
Oxford St @ Washington St
Oxford St @ Market St

-A diversion schedule will be in effect.

-An express shuttle will operate nonstop between North Station and Swampscott.

-A local shuttle will operate between North Station and Swampscott, making all local stops.

-Riders using the shuttle buses should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to North Station from Swampscott should budget up to 40 minutes additional travel on the express shuttle and up to 70 minutes additional travel on the local shuttle.

Shuttle bus pick-up/drop-off locations:

NORTH STATION: Nashua St @ Red Auerbach Way

CHELSEA: Inbound, Everett Ave @ Vale St (MBTA Route 112 bus stop). Outbound, Everett Ave @ Maple St (MBTA Route 112 bus stop).

WONDERLAND: Wonderland Blue Line Station Busway (behind Berth E)

LYNN: Lynn Station Busway Berth #1 (MBTA Routes 441 & 442 bus stop)

SWAMPSCOTT: Railroad Ave @ Swampscott Station

Affected stops:
Northern Ave @ Tide St (outbound)
Northern Ave @ Tide St (inbound)

-A diversion schedule will be in effect.

-Passengers can use the Orange Line for service between North Station and Oak Grove.

-There will be normal Commuter Rail weekend train service between Oak Grove and Haverhill.

-There will be no shuttle buses provided for this diversion.

-Riders using the Orange Line should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to North Station from Oak Grove should budget at least 10 minutes of travel in addition to their regular trip time.

Affected direction: Inbound

Affected stops:
Main St @ Union St
Main St @ Harvard St
Main St @ City Sq
Affected direction: Inbound

Affected stops:
Mt Auburn St @ Longfellow Rd (outbound)
Mt Auburn St @ Sparks St (outbound)
Mt Auburn St opp Sparks St (inbound)
Please see station personnel or use a station call box to request assistance.

- A diversion schedule will be in effect.

- Passengers can use the Red Line for travel between Porter and Park St.

- Passengers can use the Green Line for travel between Park St and North Station.

- Passengers traveling to/from North Station should budget extra travel time. For example, a rider traveling to North Station from Porter should budget at least 20 minutes of travel in addition to their regular trip time.
